The only game I keep coming back to year after year, it just stays fun. The core mechanics are extremely solid and satisfying. Competitive is thrilling and is even better with friends, it runs on all machines and is easy to pick up, hard to master. Tons of game modes if you want to do something else, and constantly updated. Truly a classic.
its the best fps, you will also be called racial slurs. pros and cons to everything

Over the years, the game has been on a steep decline and as of recently, they are trying to treat this game like another, far more popular and successful 5v5 tactical team based shooter. They have slowly made me KIND OF enjoy it, but that is because the community has seemingly lost a LOT of its toxicity that plagued it for YEARS. I was once a Legendary Eagle before they revamped the ranking system, essentially requiring twice as many wins to rank up, and half as many to derank, on top of the matchmaking being relative ass, thanks to the cancer team mates you would get. You either got full cancer tryhards, or trolls who were either smurfing (which was another big problem for a long time) or just people fucking around. Overall, since I started playing CSGO specifically in 2013, the game has been dogshit, but since I started after a year long haitus, it has gotten better. Still would never suggest someone play this game, it is a coin flip if you are going to get aids, or have fun.
